official_title: Phase III Trial of Observation Versus Irradiation for a Gross Totally Resected Grade II Meningioma
brief_title: Observation or Radiation Therapy in Treating Patients With Newly Diagnosed Grade II Meningioma That Has Been Completely Removed by Surgery
cancer_type_display: A study for patients with newly diagnosed Grade II meningioma that has been completely removed by surgery.
prior_treatments_excluded: Previous radiotherapy to the scalp, cranium, brain, or skull base
site_name: University of Alabama at Birmingham Cancer Center

key_inclusion_summary: Patients must have a newly diagnosed, unifocal, intracranial WHO grade II meningioma.
The tumor must have been completely removed by surgery (gross total resection, modified Simpson grade 1-3).
Patients must be 18 years of age or older.
Must have a post-operative Zubrod performance status of 0-1.
key_exclusion_summary: Excludes patients with optic nerve sheath, spinal, other extracranial, or multiple meningiomas.
Patients with definitive evidence of metastatic meningioma are not eligible.
Patients with a prior invasive malignancy are excluded unless they have been disease-free for a minimum of 3 years.
Previous radiotherapy to the scalp, cranium, brain, or skull base is not allowed.
Patients unable to undergo an MRI with and without contrast are excluded.
